newsitem.title: CHINA: China's commercial and industrial tax up in April.
newsitem.headline: China's commercial and industrial tax up in April.

text.p: China's commercial and industrial tax revenues increased by 17.7 percent from January to April compared with the year-ago period, the Xinhau news agency said on Thursday.
That accounted for 31.9 percent of the target for the whole year, it said.
In April alone, China collected 2.11 billion yuan ($254 million) in personal income tax, up by 41.2 percent compared with a year ago, it said.
Income tax revenues collected from foreign invested enterprises and foreign firms was 2.28 billion yuan in April, rising by 51.7 percent compared with the year-ago period, it said.
Stock trading stamp tax revenues reached 2.54 billion yuan in the month, soaring 55 times compared with a year ago.

The government paid 3.545 billion yuan in export tax rebates in April, the highest amount so far this year, rising by 16.7 percent compared with the year-ago period, Xinhua said. Beijing wants to acclerate delayed repayment of the rebates to spur exports.
